noun.description: A circular frame for holding fabric taut while it is being embroidered.
A wall of circular plan, such as one supporting a dome or surrounded by a colonnade.
A sliding flexible shutter or door on a piece of furniture, made of strips of wood attached to a backing of canvas.
A projecting part of the wall of a tennis court.

verb.description: Decorate or embroider on a tambour.

origin: Late 15th century: from French tambour drum; perhaps related to Persian tabīra drum. Compare with tabor.
